thread.title: Lincoln-Way East football miscues prove costly against No. 1 Homewood-Flossmoor
thread.title_full: Lincoln-Way East football miscues prove costly against No. 1 Homewood-Flossmoor

title: Lincoln-Way East football miscues prove costly against No. 1 Homewood-Flossmoor
text:
Lincoln-Way East football miscues prove costly against No. 1 Homewood-Flossmoor Published: Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 12:16 a.m. CDT By DRAKE SKLEBA - Shaw Media Correspondent 
FLOSSMOOR â€“ Running back Liam Morrissey had just ripped off a 9-yard blast, and Lincoln-Way East had a first-and-10 at the Homewood-Flossmoor 22-yard line. The Griffins trailed 7-3 with four minutes to go until halftime against the top-ranked Vikings in the SouthWest Suburban Blue showdown. Related Links Lockport football gets big stop to win game 
On the next play, disaster struck. 
Griffin quarterback Brandon Bauer (13 carries, 71 yards rushing) was separated from the ball by a bone-crunching hit. H-F's Justin Hall scooped it up and raced 68 yards for a touchdown to give the Vikings a 14-3 lead. 
The Griffin kick-return unit failed to catch H-F's ensuing kickoff. But the Vikings did at the Griffin 28-yard line. 
A minute later, H-F's Devonte Harley-Hampton (17 carries, 132 yards, two touchdowns) crashed in from the 2-yard line to give the Vikings a 21-3 halftime lead. 
The second half featured a valiant effort from the Griffin defense led by defensive linemen Ben Christensen and Dan Cooper, free safety Jayison McCorkle and linebacker Pat Carr. Refusing to lose, the Griffin defenders turned back the ball on a fourth and goal at the Griffin 1-foot line in the third quarter. 
McCorkle, who already had a fumble recovery in the first half, blocked a Viking field goal attempt with 10 minutes left in the game. Carr scooped up the blocked kick and raced 56 yards down to the Viking 21-yard line. 
Bauer hit Griffin wide receiver Logan Winkler with a pass at the Viking 18. Winkler was nailed with another hit and fumbled the ball. Game over. 
Bauer went 11 for 16 passing for 82 yards and Morrissey had 11 carries for 73 yards. 
With the win, H-F (7-0, 5-0) shares the SouthWest Suburban Blue penthouse with Sandburg (6-1, 5-0). The two will battle at Sandburg next Friday. 
Lincoln-Way East (5-2, 4-1), will look to rebound at Joliet Central next Saturday afternoon.
